com.js.huffman.io

Class BitOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • java.io.FileOutputStream
        • com.js.huffman.io.BitOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class BitOutputStream
extends FileOutputStream
    Provides functionality for writing individual bits to a file.
    Author:
    jack

    • Constructor Summary

      Create a new BitOutputStreams

    • Method Detail

      • setFileChannel

        public final void setFileChannel()
        Set this BitOutputStream's file channel for IO.

      • writeHuffmanCode

        public void writeHuffmanCode(String code)
        Write a Huffman code to one or more bytes. The writing process is 'continious' - that is, a code of 3 bits will be written to a single byte while allowing other codes to be written to the same byte. The same applies if the code is larger than 8 bits.
        Parameters:
        code -

      • writeMetadata

        public void writeMetadata(byte[] treeRep,
                          String symbols,
                          byte emptyTreeBits)
        Write our metadata to our binary file before the encoded data.
        Parameters:
        treeRep - byte representation of our huffman tree
        symbols - String of all symbols in the huffman tree.
        emptyTreeBits - no. of empty bits in the final byte of @treeRep
        See Also:
        MetadataBuilder

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Write any non-complete bytes to our file, before flushing the buffer.

        public long getCount()

      • getEndExtraBits

        public int getEndExtraBits()
        Get the number of empty bits at EOF.
        Returns:
        the empty bits in the final byte.

      • getMetadataBytes

        public int getMetadataBytes()
        Get the size of the metadata in the file.
        Returns:
        the size of the binary metadata in bytes.
